alert.note: Alert for Edgar; Vermilion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 1:56PM CDT until June 29 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT FOR EDGAR...CLARK...VERMILION AND SOUTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES... At 155 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rossville to 6 miles west of Newport to Martinsville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Marshall and Dennison. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 near mile marker 120, and between mile markers 132 and 154. Interstate 74 between mile markers 201 and 220. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
